title: CallCraftAI: production domain hardening + in-app hostname indicator

requirements.summary: Ensure the SPA consistently serves from the intended production domain (callcraftai.caffeine.xyz) and is not dependent on the draft/temporary Caffeine URL.
acceptanceCriteria: Visiting callcraftai.caffeine.xyz loads the CallCraftAI marketing site (the React SPA), not a Caffeine placeholder page.
A user can share callcraftai.caffeine.xyz and recipients consistently see the same live site.
The app is no longer dependent on (or only accessible from) the draft/temporary URL https://create-marketing-website-for-ai-receptionist-servi-ijk.caffeine.xyz/.

file_operations.description: Add a lightweight production-domain enforcement guard that (1) detects when the app is loaded from the known draft hostname create-marketing-website-for-ai-receptionist-servi-ijk.caffeine.xyz and (2) performs a client-side redirect to callcraftai.caffeine.xyz while preserving path/query as appropriate. Ensure this does not interfere with localhost/dev environments and remains compatible with the existing URL hash cleanup logic.
Add/adjust HTML head metadata to reflect the intended canonical production URL (callcraftai.caffeine.xyz) to reduce confusion when sharing/previewing, without introducing new pages or routes.

requirements.summary: Display an unobtrusive footer indicator showing the current hostname for quick in-app verification.
acceptanceCriteria: The footer shows a label like "Domain: <current-hostname>" using English text.
The label updates correctly when the site is loaded from different hostnames (draft URL vs free domain).
The indicator does not break layout on mobile and desktop.
